intro: Centaurea hyssopifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf knapweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright, branching stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often with a bluish-gray hue due to a dense covering of trichomes. The showy purple to pink flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
